mini_game
Class MiniGameDataModel

java.lang.Object
  mini_game.MiniGameDataModel

public abstract class MiniGameDataModel
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides the base class for a game data management class. Note that general game data is already provided and managed here. A sub-class would provide the game-specific data.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Richard McKenna

          Default constructor, it should be invoked by any child class.

Constructor Detail

public MiniGameDataModel()
Default constructor, it should be invoked by any child class.

Method Detail

getDebugText

public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getDebugText()
For accessing the Vector containing the debug text being stored for optional display. return the Vector that stores all the debug text.

getDebugTextX

public int getDebugTextX()
For accessing the x coordinate of the debug text. return the x coordinate of where we will start rendering the debug text.

getDebugTextY

public int getDebugTextY()
For accessing the y coordinate of the debug text.

Returns:
the y coordinate of where we will start rendering the debug text.

getGameHeight

public int getGameHeight()
For accessing the height of the game's canvas, and consequently the game world.

Returns:
the height of the game world playing surface.

getGameWidth

public int getGameWidth()
For accessing the width of the game's canvas, and consequently the game world.

Returns:
the width of the game world playing surface.

getGameState

public mini_game.MiniGameState getGameState()
For accessing the current game state.

Returns:
the current state of the game, which may only be one of NOT_STARTED, IN_PROGRESS, LOSS, or WIN

getSpriteType

public SpriteType getSpriteType(java.lang.String id)
For accessing the SpriteType object that corresponds to the id parameter. We do this because a game may have many Sprites that share a SpriteType, so this provides an easy access point for all of them for whoever needs it.

Parameters:
id - the textual description of the sprite type to be accessed
Returns:
the SpriteType object corresponding to the id

isDebugTextRenderingActive

public boolean isDebugTextRenderingActive()
For asking if the debug text is currently being rendered.

Returns:
true if the debug text is currently active, and thus renderable, false otherwise.

isPaused

public boolean isPaused()
For asking if the game is currently paused.

Returns:
true if the game is paused, false otherwise

inProgress

public boolean inProgress()
Asks if the game is currently in progress or not.

Returns:
true if the game is currently in progress, meaning gameplay is active, false otherwise.

lost

public boolean lost()
Asks if the game is over and the player lost or not.

Returns:
true if the game is over and the player lost

won

public boolean won()
Asks if the game is over and the player won or not.

Returns:
true if the game is over and the player won

activateDebugTextRendering

public void activateDebugTextRendering()
Activates the debug text, allowing it to be rendered.

addSpriteType

public void addSpriteType(SpriteType spriteTypeToAdd)
Adds the spriteTypeToAdd parameter to the data model using the sprite type's id value as the binary search tree key.

Parameters:
spriteTypeToAdd - the constructed sprite to be stored.

beginGame

public void beginGame()
Mutator method for setting the game state to GameState.IN_PROGRESS

deactivateDebugTextRendering

public void deactivateDebugTextRendering()
Deactivates the debug text, preventing it from being rendered.

endGameAsLoss

public void endGameAsLoss()
Mutator method for setting the game state to GameState.LOSS

endGameAsWin

public void endGameAsWin()
Mutator method for setting the game state to GameState.WIN

incDebugText

public void incDebugText(int incX,
                         int incY)
Moves the position of the debug text by the provided increment.

Parameters:
incX - the amount by which to move the debug text on screen in the x axis.
incY - the amount by which to move the debug text on screen in the y axis.

pause

public void pause()
Pauses the game, meaning all game logic gets skipped.

setGameDimensions

public void setGameDimensions(int initGameWidth,
                              int initGameHeight)
Mutator method for setting the dimensions of the playing surface.

Parameters:
initGameWidth - width in pixels of the playing surface
initGameHeight - height in pixels of the playing surface

setGameState

public void setGameState(mini_game.MiniGameState initGameState)
Mutator method for setting the game state.

Parameters:
initGameState - the game state to use.

unpause

public void unpause()
Unpauses the game, allowing game logic to be executed each frame.

checkMousePressOnSprites

public abstract void checkMousePressOnSprites(MiniGame game,
                                              int x,
                                              int y)
Provided on a game-to-game basis, this allows for a custom response for when the player clicks on a Sprite. This method is called once per frame and should test and respond for all needed Sprites in the game. Note that the x,y coordinates provided refer to the canvas coordinates of the mouse click.

Parameters:
game - the game currently being played, this has access to all the data in the system either directly or indirectly.
x - the x-axis location of the mouse press
y - the y-axis location of the mosue press

reset

public abstract void reset(MiniGame game)
For resetting all game data to the start of a new game.

Parameters:
game - the game in progress

updateAll

public abstract void updateAll(MiniGame game)
Called each frame, this method is for updating all the game data that is particular to the custom game application.

Parameters:
game - the game in progress that is to be udated.

updateDebugText

public abstract void updateDebugText(MiniGame game)
Called each frame, this method is for updating the debug text that may be currently displayed.

Parameters:
game - the game in progress from this method will likely derive the textual description for debugging purposes.
